cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-north-eastward along the southeast U.S. coast and then accelerating northeast offshore toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England waters
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast (near Charleston/Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, and the Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from north of Savannah River GA to the NC/VA border; Tropical-Storm Warning northward to Chincoteague VA; Storm-Surge Warning Flagler/Volusia County FL line to Poquoson VA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from Florida through the Carolinas, then offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Outer fringes of Dorian may bring occasional gusts 25–35 mph Friday night into Saturday with only a small (≤6 %) chance of reaching tropical-storm force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures and rough surf/rip currents possible, but significant surge >3 ft not expected in New York Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could drop 1–2 inches of rain mainly Saturday; widespread 4-inch totals are unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and short-period scheduling restrictions for vessels transiting the approaches to New York Harbor.
